title: Eve feels really, really bad with the change to her W
body:
Passive - Shadow Walk
COOLDOWN ON ENTERING STEALTH 6 seconds ⇒ 6/5/4/3 seconds (at levels 1/6/11/16)
W - Dark Frenzy
REMOVED GOTTA GO FAST Spell hits no longer passively grant stacking movement speed
NEW ULTRA RAPID FRENZY Spell hits now lower Dark Frenzy's cooldown by 1 second

Long time eve main here (since season 2)
I was really concerned with the removal of her stacking movement speed passive on her W when i first saw it on PBE, but I wasn't really sure how it would pan out overall with the addition of the cooldown lowering mechanic. 
After experiencing the change, honestly to me it feels really bad. Like.. her movement speed was absolutely gutted with this change (previously granting 16/32/48/64/80 flat movement speed which was just completely removed, which also scaled with her % movement speed gains from her build and such), and I don't really feel the cooldown reduction is satisfying at all, ESPECIALLY considering it already resets on kills/assists. 

like yeah its cool to use her W more often but the whole thing is that it has a great impact on her playstyle in general, being mobile in fights and such in order to avoid and kite. This has been horribly nerfed. 

Honestly I would give up her stealth going back to 6 seconds, hell I would even take it as a straight nerf and have it at 7 seconds, if the W change were to be reverted. It is just horrible and has ruined the champion for me :/ (and I've stayed with her  through so many nerfs and changes, but this is just... ugh)

replies.body: I knew I would run into one of the other 5 Eve players about this.  It is a terrible change.  Honestly, I don't need the stealth to make me disappear faster.  What I need is to be able to stick to people during my assassination attempts.  I mean really, at least the old W could keep you attached to someone.  With this new W, you have to use it to gap close or you can wait, either wait that's it.  Didn't get them in 3 seconds? Off they go.  Why would they Veigar buff Eve

Evelynn just needs an overhaul. She's a mess from all angles. She's got the vaguest lore in the game; She's got a schizophrenic kit that doesn't know if she's a tank, a mage, an assassin, or a bruiser; she's got a gaudy, juvenile model that looks like it's still rocking the N64 graphics. She's just a mess. Riot says they can't balance her because perma-stealth can lead to huge problems with her. In my eyes, they ought to just remove it and give her temporary stealth similar to Twitch, just so long as it would mean that Evelynn will become playable and cohesive.
Perma-stealth might be viable if the Mandrake Ward can detect her.

There's an item on PBE right now called Mandrake ward. It's an item designed specifically for stealthed units. What it does is it doesn't give vision, but when an enemy comes within X units of it, the item gives off a ping saying someone is there. If they manage to pull off the item.(It's been in testing for awhile) They will be able to safely buff eve due to her permastealth not being a problem anymore during laning phase.
The W change is not good in the situations where you need it to be good. It's only a buff when you are being chased, it's a nerf for everything else.
And even then, the old passive helped plenty with escapes too. No reason for this change, and it just shows the balance team knows nothing about how Eve is played.

I don't play Evelynn, but just thinking about it...

The cooldown on Dark Frenzy is 15 s. Even if you proc the reduction multiple times and have some CDR, how often are you really reactivating that ability in a single fight? So many fights are just *over* in the 6-10s (minimally) that it's going to take. The old ability gave you a movement speed bonus right away that had a chance to impact the fight right away; the new ability at best will probably just help with cleaning up a won fight or getting away from a lost fight (which isn't nothing, but isn't the same thing as actually helping you win the fight).

To be honest, I think this is a similar problem that happened with the Kassadin nerfs. They nerfed the ability but decreased the mana/cooldown to compensate. But, the most critical moments of an engage are usually the first few seconds, i.e. the first activation of the ability.

The only good news (I hope) is that they seemingly intended these changes as a buff so if Evelynn indeed performs worse they'll probably give her more love in the somewhat near future.
I really don't understand why an ability that resets on kills ALSO needs another method of reducing the cooldown.  Completely idiotic change.

This makes no sense. How does the change help with chasing compared to her previous passive? 

This is a bad change, I haven't even tried her with this nerf and I know its garbage. How? Because gaining movespeed on spell casts was/is a much better mechanic than reducing the cooldown on this ability (especially since it already resets on kills/assists). It gave you more freedom to choose to weave/run around the target or run away, it also made it so you didn't have to hit W every time it was off cooldown to go fast, you saved it to get away/chase **faster**(if you needed it) or, more importantly, to remove slows. Now you are using it as your only chase and escape option on top of what it already does. Its harder now to decide if you want to save it, because you *have* to use it to chase and escape.


Anyway, I really want this reverted.

Edit: Or leave it, but add it so AAs give the stacking movespeed. Or better yet revert it and add in that AAs reduce the cooldown.

> [{quoted}](name=Riv x Kobe,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=75zNKFJO,comment-id=001d0000,timestamp=2015-03-26T19:16:39.374+0000)
>
> This makes no sense. How does the change help with chasing compared to her previous passive? 

The passive gave 16/32/48/64/80 flat ms. The active gives 30%/40%/50%/60%/70% ms. Convert this to flat ms: 95/115/134/153/172 flat ms. So the active is better at every level.

The question is now, how much CDR do you need to get the spell back after 3 seconds?

E hits twice, therefore it reduces the CD by 2 seconds. Q and R can hit multiple targets, therefore they can reduce the CD by multiple seconds at once. But lets say you hit only 1 champion.

The combo is WRQEQQQQQQQQ. The calculation is difficult but here is the result:

With 0% CDR you need 7 seconds. (8 seconds without using R)
With 10% CDR you need 5.5 seconds. (6.5 seconds without using R)
With 20% CDR you need 4.8 seconds. (5.0 seconds without using R)
With 30% CDR you need 3.5 seconds. (4.2 seconds without using R)
With 40% CDR you need 2.7 seconds. (3.0 seconds without using R)

Yes, if have already hit 4 spells and the W is still active or after getting a kill it is a nerf, because the passive will just be missing. But the additional bonus movement speed is reduced by movement speed softcaps.

Lets do the math:
With Tier 2 boots Eve has 385 ms.
The W active+W passive boosts her ms to 491/522/555/589/625
The W active alone boosts her ms to 480/500/519/538/557. That is 2%/4%/6%/9%/11% less than with active and passive.

The W passive alone boosts her ms to 401/417/433/442/465.

I think what Riot should do is, to give Evelynn just her old W passive and the new CD reduction passive.

Now I don't play Eve, but when I saw the changes on the PBE, my first thoughts were positive.  I mean, the ability to break CC is rare in this game while the ability to gain speed is common.  Furor, Trinity Force, MoveSpeed Quints, Luden's Echo, Iceborne Gauntlet, etc.  Theoretically, the ability to break CC more frequently would give her more potential overall because she can find extra movement speed so many other ways.  

Assuming  you are able to get 40% CDR (which is entirely possible and easy to get by your 2nd or 3rd item) your Dark Frenzy is going to be on a 9s CD, 3s of uptime makes 6s of downtime.  However, it does seem like she needs additional compensation for the stacking movement speed.  

Now I'm not trying to tell all you Eve mains that you're doing it wrong.  Not many champions have the ability to break CC and I bet if you could accommodate your builds to meet the new change, you might find it works out.  Maybe sacrificing gank potential for team fight potential will make Eve a stronger champion.  With jungle tanks becoming more popular, it's likely this game will shift to more team-oriented play.  Just a possibility, try to keep an open mind.  

Lord knows I'd love to play Eve, but she just seems kinda clunky.  Base movement speed and her Q projectile doesn't seem fast enough.  If a champion is a fragile, melee assassin then I feel like they should have a MINIMUM base movement speed of 350.  Additionally, if their main ability is a 500 range projectile on such a short CD it better fly out of there FAST and it ought to be a skill-shot instead of some random attack move mechanic.  She has so much potential, but it seems like nobody on the balance team wants to touch her without the new Mandrake Ward.
